intro: Cipuropsis capituligera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a small perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant has basal leaves that are narrow and linear, with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in a dense cluster at the top of the stem. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other economically important plants.
